javadoc:
Common base class for all Ghidra string {@link DataType}s.

See {@link StringDataType} for information about string variations and configuration details.

Sub-classes generally only need to implement a constructor that calls the mega-constructor {@link #StringDataTypeBase(String, String, String, String, String, String, String, DataType, StringLayoutEnum, DataTypeManager) StringDataTypeBase.StringDataTypeBase(lots,of,params)} and the {@link DataType#clone(DataTypeManager)} method.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Protected constructor used by derived types to provide all their datatype details.

params.name: defaultLabel
params.comment: Label string for this datatype.  See #defaultLabel.

params.name: defaultLabelPrefix
params.comment: Label prefix string for this datatype.  See #defaultLabelPrefix.

params.name: defaultAbbrevLabelPrefix
params.comment: Abbreviated label prefix for this datatype.  See #defaultAbbrevLabelPrefix.

params.name: charsetName
params.comment:
Charset name for this string datatype.  If null the
 settings of the data instance will be queried for a CharsetSettingsDefinition.

params.name: stringLayout
params.comment:
StringLayoutEnum controls how the string is laid
 out in memory.

params.name: dtm
params.comment: DataTypeManager for this datatype, null ok.

methods.name: getStringDataInstance
methods.comment:
Creates a new StringDataInstance using the bytes in the supplied MemBuffer and
 options provided by this DataType.

params.name: settings
params.comment: the settings to use for the representation.

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of bytes to represent.

name: AbstractStringDataType
comment:
Common base class for all Ghidra string DataTypes.
 
 See StringDataType for information about string variations and configuration details.
 
 Sub-classes generally only need to implement a constructor that calls the mega-constructor
 #StringDataTypeBase(String, String, String, String, String, String, String, DataType, StringLayoutEnum, DataTypeManager)
 and the DataType#clone(DataTypeManager) method.

fields.javadoc:
A symbolic name to signal that the null value being passed for the charset name param
 indicates that the default charset (ie. ASCII) should be used.
fields.name: USE_CHARSET_DEF_DEFAULT
fields.comment:
A symbolic name to signal that the null value being passed for the charset name param
 indicates that the default charset (ie. ASCII) should be used.

fields.javadoc:
The name of the character set used to convert bytes into java native Strings.

If null, the {@link CharsetSettingsDefinition settings} attached to the data instance will be queried for a charset, which will default to ASCII if not present.
fields.name: charsetName
fields.comment:
The name of the character set used to convert bytes into java native Strings.
 
 If null, the CharsetSettingsDefinition attached to the data
 instance will be queried for a charset, which will default to ASCII if not present.

fields.javadoc: List of {@link SettingsDefinition} that this datatype supports.
fields.name: settingsDefinition
fields.comment: List of SettingsDefinition that this datatype supports.

fields.javadoc: Enum that controls how the string is laid out in memory.
fields.name: stringLayout
fields.comment: Enum that controls how the string is laid out in memory.

fields.javadoc:
String used as a prefix to the data instance location when creating a label when there is a problem accessing the string data.

Example: "STRING" produces something like: "STRING_00410ea0"

This string should be the longest when compared to label prefix and abbrev label prefix.
fields.name: defaultLabel
fields.comment:
String used as a prefix to the data instance location when creating a label when
 there is a problem accessing the string data.
 
 Example: "STRING" produces something like: "STRING_00410ea0"
 
 This string should be the longest when compared to label prefix and abbrev label prefix.

fields.javadoc:
String used as a prefix to the data instance location when creating a label.

Example: "STR" produces something like: "STR_00410ea0"

This string should be a medium length when compared to label and abbrev label prefix.
fields.name: defaultLabelPrefix
fields.comment:
String used as a prefix to the data instance location when creating a label.
 
 Example: "STR" produces something like: "STR_00410ea0"
 
 This string should be a medium length when compared to label and abbrev label prefix.

fields.javadoc:
String used as a prefix to a portion of the actual string data when creating a label.

Example: "s" produces something like: "s_Hello_World_00410ea0"

This string should be the shortest length when compared to label and label prefix.
fields.name: defaultAbbrevLabelPrefix
fields.comment:
String used as a prefix to a portion of the actual string data when creating a label.
 
 Example: "s" produces something like: "s_Hello_World_00410ea0"
 
 This string should be the shortest length when compared to label and label prefix.
